{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the documents, both Type I and Type III collagen are present in healing and granulation tissue. However, Type III collagen is more prominent during the early stages of wound healing and plays a role in granulation tissue formation. Later, it is replaced by the stronger Type I collagen. Therefore, both Type I and Type III collagen are involved in the process, but Type III is the initial type present.", "answer_choice": "C. Type III"}
